title: High Vibrational People: How to Spot Them and How to Become One

steps.title: High vibrational people have positive energy that vibrates at a high level.
steps.content: High vibrational people have positive energy that vibrates at a high level. Some wellness and spiritual communities believe in the law of vibration, which suggests that everything in the world is vibrating at a specific frequency. Some emotions (like fear or shame) vibrate at a lower frequency, while other emotions (like love or happiness) vibrate at a higher frequency. [1] X Research source High vibrational people have learned to raise their vibrations through their actions and lifestyles. When you vibrate at a higher frequency, you feel lighter and more joyful. On the other hand, lower vibrations feel heavier and cause negative emotions.

steps.title: You’re empathetic and compassionate.
steps.content: You’re empathetic and compassionate. Love is one of the highest vibrating states of being, and it helps fight low vibrational energies. If you’re a high vibrational person, you likely have a general feeling of love for the people around you, which makes it easy to put yourself in their shoes. If empathy and compassion come naturally to you, it could be a sign that you’re on a high vibration.

steps.title: You’re generous.
steps.content: You’re generous. Stinginess and greed have low vibrational energy, whereas generosity raises your vibrations. High-vibrational people generally avoid a lack mindset (“I need more money”) and instead cultivate gratitude (“I’m thankful for what I have”). [2] X Research source This makes them more generous toward others when they have the means to be. If you’re a generous person, this is a good sign that you’re living a high vibrational lifestyle.

steps.title: You're incredibly optimistic.
steps.content: You're incredibly optimistic. Under the law of vibration, thoughts vibrate at their own frequencies. As a result, negative thoughts can drag down your vibration, while positive thoughts can elevate you to a higher vibrational level. If you're filled with optimistic, high vibrational thoughts, there's a good chance you're also vibrating at an elevated frequency.

steps.title: You feel good.
steps.content: You feel good. Feelings and emotions also vibrate on their own frequencies. Emotions like joy, happiness, and gratitude are high vibrational, while shame, regret, and jealousy vibrate at a lower frequency. [3] X Research source If you’re a high vibrational person, you likely feel high vibrational emotions more often than you feel low vibrational ones.

steps.title: You’re forgiving.
steps.content: You’re forgiving. Blame is a low-vibrational energy. Letting go of low vibrational feelings like blame helps you raise your vibrations and get to a higher frequency. If you’re good at releasing feelings of blame and gracefully forgiving others, this is a good sign that you’re living a high vibrational lifestyle.

steps.title: You have good boundaries.
steps.content: You have good boundaries. Although you have increased empathy and a forgiving nature, you don't compromise your own wellbeing to cater to others' needs because doing so could lower your vibrations. [4] X Research source If you're good at protecting your own energy and saying "no" when you need to, this is a good sign that you've been able to cultivate and protect a high vibrational frequency in your life.

steps.title: You’re great at manifesting.
steps.content: You’re great at manifesting. Your thoughts have vibrational energy, so high-vibrational thoughts attract high vibrational things to your life. [5] X Research source If you’re a high vibrational person, manifesting likely comes naturally to you, and good things come your way often.

steps.title: You practice mindfulness.
steps.content: You practice mindfulness . Mindfulness involves focusing on what you’re feeling in the present moment while avoiding judging yourself, and it involves practices like meditation. [6] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Practicing mindfulness raises your positive vibrations, so if you’ve prioritized mindfulness in your life, this is a good sign that you’re living a high vibrational lifestyle. [7] X Research source

steps.title: You have good intuition.
steps.content: You have good intuition. Many lifestyle practices that raise your vibrations, like meditation, mindfulness, and spending time in nature, can also develop and strengthen your intuition . [8] X Research source If you have a strong intuition and you feel like you can always trust your gut, this could be a sign that you’re living a high vibrational lifestyle, and that it’s paying off.

steps.title: You love to take care of your body.
steps.content: You love to take care of your body. Eating high vibrational foods and staying physically active are important aspects of cultivating high vibrational energy. Heavier, unhealthy foods can bog you down and lower your energy, whereas healthier, nutrient-dense foods elevate your vibration. [9] X Research source If you love to take care of your body with food and movement, this could be a sign that you’re a high vibrational person.

steps.title: You do yoga.
steps.content: You do yoga. Yoga can help you release stagnant energy and raise your vibration. [10] X Research source Yoga is also a form of exercise, and staying active also cultivates high vibrational energy. If you do yoga on a regular basis, this grounding, spiritual practice has likely done wonders for your vibration level!

steps.title: You’re outdoorsy.
steps.content: You’re outdoorsy. Connecting with nature can positively affect your mood and raise your vibration levels. If you love spending time in the great outdoors and appreciate the beauty of nature, this is a strong sign that you’re vibrating at an elevated frequency.

steps.title: You consume high vibrational media.
steps.content: You consume high vibrational media. TV, movies, and music also vibrate at specific frequencies. As a result, certain media could lower your vibrations. For example, if you’re feeling anxious or pessimistic after watching a violent action movie, this may have to do with low vibrational energy. If you’re drawn to uplifting, positive media, this could be a sign that you’re living a high vibrational lifestyle.

steps.title: People trust you and gravitate toward you.
steps.content: People trust you and gravitate toward you. If you’re a high vibrational person, you have many qualities that make people want to be your friend. Your forgiving, upbeat, loving, and generous nature makes people feel safe and happy around you. If you make friends easily and feel like people are drawn toward you, high vibrational energy could be the reason!

steps.title: You’re surrounded by positive people.
steps.content: You’re surrounded by positive people. The law of vibration is all about matching the frequency of what you’re looking for. [11] X Research source If you’ve sought out and built relationships with high vibrational people, this suggests that you’ve matched their frequency and are also living on a high vibration. For more tips on reading people's vibrations, check out wikiHow's "How Do I Know if Someone Is High Vibration?" forum .

steps.title: Low vibrational people are individuals who are vibrating at a lower frequency.
steps.content: Low vibrational people are individuals who are vibrating at a lower frequency. Low vibrational energy feels heavier and darker than high vibrational energy, and it’s associated with more negative feelings. Here are some signs of low vibrational energy to look out for: You experience low vibrational emotions (like fear or shame) more often than high vibrational ones (like joy or love). [12] X Research source You’re stuck in a scarcity mindset, meaning you focus on what you don’t have, rather than cultivating gratefulness for what you do have. [13] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source You have a hard time empathizing with others and putting yourself in their shoes. You are self-critical and too hard on yourself, or you talk to yourself unkindly. You’re unhappy with your relationship with alcohol or with your diet, and you feel like your physical health might need some TLC.

steps.title: Practice mindfulness.
steps.content: Practice mindfulness. Mindfulness involves focusing on what you’re feeling in the present moment while avoiding judgment. [14] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source It’s also a sure-fire way to raise your vibrations. [15] X Research source . If you’re looking to become a high vibrational person, try out mindful meditation . Mindful meditation involves focusing on the present moment. It can reduce stress and promote physical wellbeing. [16] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Sit down in a quiet place and focus on what you’re experiencing. Feel the flow of your breath, and let any thoughts that come up pass without judgment. [17] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Prioritize self-care.
steps.content: Prioritize self-care. Taking care of yourself can raise your vibration and help you be more present. [18] X Research source Take the time to do something you enjoy to show yourself some love and cultivate positive emotions. If you love nature, go on a scenic hike or spend the day at the beach. If you need some rest, treat yourself to a bubble bath or a night in watching your favorite movie. Being kind to yourself will help you be kind to others, which will help you raise your vibration! Reader Poll: We asked 866 wikiHow readers, and 58% agreed that the best way to prioritize self-care is to get regular exercise and physical activity . [Take Poll]

steps.title: Think positive.
steps.content: Think positive. Thoughts also have their own vibration, so negative thoughts can drag you down to a lower vibration, and thinking positively can help you get to a higher frequency. It can also have great effects on your health, leading to increased lifespan, lower rates of depression, and greater resistance to illness. [19] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Here are some tips to think more positively : Practice positive self-talk. This means following the golden rule: don’t say anything to yourself that you wouldn’t say to someone else. [20] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Be kind, encouraging, and gentle with yourself. Remember, you deserve the same kindness you would show others! Try reframing. This involves shifting your perspective to focus on the positive in a situation, rather than the negative. For example, if you’re stuck in traffic, try to focus on feeling gratitude for having a car that can get you where you need to be. [21] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source Or, if you receive a bad grade, try to think of it as an opportunity to learn and grow, rather than a disappointment.

steps.title: Work on gratitude.
steps.content: Work on gratitude. Gratitude is a powerful force that can carry you to a high vibrational state. [22] X Research source It can also have a positive effect on your mental health—research shows that gratitude is consistently associated with greater happiness and wellbeing. [23] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source Here are some tips for cultivating gratitude: Keep a gratitude journal . [24] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source Writing down the good things in your life can remind you of how much there is to be thankful for! Write a thank you letter to someone in your life. [25] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source If you have a friend who has gone out of their way for you, let them know it’s made a difference!

steps.title: Explore wellness and spirituality.
steps.content: Explore wellness and spirituality. Wellness practices like yoga and spiritual practices like healing with crystals can help boost your positive energy and raise your vibrations. Don’t be afraid to try something new—it can broaden your perspective and help you cultivate a high-vibrational lifestyle! Incorporate yoga into your schedule to promote your physical and mental wellbeing. Check out a beginner’s class, or practice in the comfort of your home with online instructional videos! Stones like amethyst and rose quartz promote connection and love. Place them around your home, wear them in jewelry, or carry them in your bag to make use of their properties. [26] X Research source

steps.title: Eat high-vibrational food.
steps.content: Eat high-vibrational food. Many wellness and spirituality communities believe that eating animal products, such as meat, dairy or eggs, has a negative affect on your energy frequency. Additionally, many believe that heavy, unhealthy foods can also lower your vibrations. [27] X Research source Eating a higher vibrational diet filled with whole foods, fruits, and vegetables can help you vibrate at a higher frequency. Don’t worry—you don’t have to go fully vegan or become a vegetarian to raise your vibrations if you’re not comfortable with that! Simply cutting back on meat products and incorporating more plant-based meals into your diet can have a positive effect. Try incorporating a meatless Monday into your routine (abstaining from eating meat one day per week), and see how you feel. Abstain from overly processed or packaged food, or have them in moderation, in order to incorporate more whole foods into your diet.

steps.title: Cut down on alcohol.
steps.content: Cut down on alcohol. Since alcohol is a depressant, too much of it can lower your vibrations. Lowering your alcohol intake can help you live a more high vibrational life, and it can also have a positive effect on your physical and mental health. [28] X Research source If you’re looking to take a break from alcohol, try out some fun mocktail recipes, or check out sober bars or events in your area!

steps.title: Surround yourself with high-vibrational people.
steps.content: Surround yourself with high-vibrational people. The energies of the people around us can have a serious effect on our own energies. Spending time with low vibrational people can bring you down to a lower frequency, while spending time with high vibrational people can help you vibrate on a higher level. [29] X Research source Surround yourself with people who make you feel loved and supported, rather than people who treat you or others poorly.
